title: WCAS HISTORY 101-6-22 First-Year Seminar-European History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course, we will study the way that Europeans responded to the growing political, economic, social, and cultural power of the United States since the end of the U.S. Civil War. Themes of the course include, but are not limited to: the attraction of America as an untrammeled frontier and place for reinvention, the allure of American bodies and their creative and destructive potential during the First and Second World Wars, the rise of American consumer and commercial culture in the post-war reconstruction, the challenge and opportunity brought by African-Americans immigrants in Europe escaping Jim Crow, and the transatlantic communication between American and European protest groups in the 1960s and 1970s.
